snippet: A survey shows Alzheimer’s, high blood pressure and heart disease are the most common conditions among patients in assisted living facilities, with many having two or more.
abstract: Hannah Fairfield Visuals column features diagram illustrating complex interaction of heart disease, high blood pressure, Alzheimer's disease and dementia among 733,000 residents at American assisted living facilities; data from 2010 study by National Center for Health Statistics indicates need for research on how conditions affect each other and emphasis on integrated care for those suffering from multiple conditions.
lead_paragraph: A survey shows Alzheimer’s, high blood pressure and heart disease are the most common conditions among patients in assisted living facilities, with many having two or more.

headline.seo: Overlapping Health Worries for the Elderly
